abstract: abandoned dented car could be one that killed mum-of-two in christmas day horror smash .
article: an abandoned car with a huge dent in its bonnet could be the one that killed a mum-of-two in a horrific christmas day crash , cops have said . officers have released pictures of a damaged blue 2008 peugeot , which they believe may have been involved in the fatal hit-and-run on a manchester crossing . men mediasharon hamnett , 44 , died after being struck by a car as she walked home from family celebrations at about 9 pm on december 25 , manchester evening news reports . police sergeant brian orr , of gmp 's serious collision investigation unit , said : `` we are releasing the photos of this vehicle so that people know exactly what information we are looking for in our investigation .

`` if you saw the peugeot on christmas day prior to the collision in the manchester area or another area , please get in touch with us as soon as you can . `` we 've examined cctv in the area and are keen to speak to three men who were seen walking along oldham road , near to the junction of queens road shortly after the collision took place . '' men mediapa : press associationsgt orr continued : `` did you see them ? did you see anyone in the car ? we need to hear from you if you did to find out exactly what happened and who is responsible for this tragedy . ''

ms hamnett was taken to hospital following the collision in the miles platting area of the city where she died . tributes have been paid to the mum , who the manchester evening news reports has two grown up kids in their 20s . writing on facebook , nicola o'malley said : `` i ca n't believe it . `` rip sharon . thinking of all her family today . i 'm absolutely gutted . '' men mediapa : press associationpa : press associationpa : press associationa 32-year-old man had been arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving in the aftermath of the crash but has since been released without charge .

anyone with information should contact gmp 's serious collision investigation unit on 0161 856 4741 or crimestoppers , anonymously , on 0800 555 111 . do you have a story for the sun online news team ? email us at tips@the-sun . co. uk or call 0207 782 4368 .
